cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 270 miles southwest of Mobile, Alabama
cyclone.trajectory: moving north toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then forecast to turn northeast across Mississippi and Alabama toward Georgia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near the Louisiana coast east of Morgan City

weather_observation.warning_coast: East of Morgan City, LA, to the Okaloosa/Walton County line, FL (includes Mobile Bay)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through Mississippi, Alabama, and the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Brief periods of tropical-storm-force winds (35-45 mph) possible Saturday as the center passes west of Mobile
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2-3 ft surge possible in Mobile Bay around the time of high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 4â€“7 inches of rain with locally higher totals could cause flash and urban flooding in the Mobile area
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado risk in outer rainbands on Saturday
